III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-
Description resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was physically assaulted by other youth on three separate
occasions. On 7/21/23, youth was struck in the left side of the
head which resulted in pain and hearing loss for which youth
requested medical attention, outcome of which is unknown at
present time. On 8/7/23, youth was punched in the face by
another youth with facility staff immediately present. On 8/9/23,
youth was assaulted by two youth also while facility staff were
immediately present.
Investigation A complaint was received on 8/22/23 which stated Youth A has
been detained since July 10, 2023 and is in imminent risk of harm
due to being repeatedly assaulted physically by other
youth, and staff failing to protect him, resulting in Youth A
reporting hearing loss. The assaults were as follows:
• On July 21, 2023, Youth A was hit in the left side of the
head which resulted in pain and hearing loss. Youth A
requested medical attention.
• On August 7, 2023, Youth A was punched in the face by
another youth. Staff were present.
• On August 9, 2023, Youth A was assaulted by two peers
also while staff were present.
Interviews
A phone message was left for the complainant on 8/22/23 but
a return phone call was not received.
Face to face at the facility on 8/23/23 Assistant Director indicated
they are having trouble preventing fights. They have had more
fights now that they cannot seclude. They did change Youth A to a
different unit after the fights, so he was separated from the youth.
He was moved on 8/9/23. She said Youth A is an easy target for
the other kids. She reported she watches video on every assault.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/23/23.
He reported he could not remember what day he got into a fight
with Youth B. He said the group was outside in the commons area
tossing a football around. Youth B walked up to Youth A, punched
him, then walked away. Another youth told Youth B to hit Youth A
so he did. Youth A reported staff were present. The staff took
Youth A to medical to have him checked out. Youth B had to be in
his room for a day. He stated the staff out in the yard with them
2

were Staff 1 and Staff 2. At the time Youth B hit him the staff were
talking and looked away. The staff came over and intervened as
soon as they figured out what happened. The second fight
occurred in the gym with Youth C. Youth A reported Youth C was
upset with another youth and he could not access that youth so
Youth C took it out on Youth A. Youth C hit Youth A then backed
up. Staff 3 was present, and she approached them. Youth A
walked away, and Youth C ran up to him and started hitting him
again. Youth C took off and was placed in his room. Youth A said
he was checked out by the nurse. He had a bruised jaw and that
was it. There was no other staff present for this incident. Staff 3
was trying to hold Youth C back. For the third fight Youth C was
trying to get Youth A to trade him his snack. Youth A said no and
told Staff 2 about it. Staff 2 sat next to Youth A in the unit but then
went on break. Youth C asked Staff 5 if he could put cards on the
windowsill. Both Youth C and Youth D got up and approached
Youth A and started to hit him. Staff 5 radioed for help while he
ran over to Youth C and pulled him off Youth A. Youth A said he
saw the nurse and had a headache from his head hitting the floor.
He stated Youth C wanted to fight Youth A because Youth A
would not trade his snack with Youth C. After this fight Youth A
was moved to a different unit and has not had any incidents since.
He stated he feels safe in his current unit. He did not think there
was anything staff could have done to prevent the incidents.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/23/23.
Youth B stated he did get into a fight with Youth A. He said it was
his first week at the facility. The group was in the commons
outside playing basketball. Youth A began to talk “smack” about
him and saying Youth B did things he did not do so he went up to
him and hit him. Youth B stated staff were there and saw it
happen. He said he has been in other fights and staff are always
present to break it up.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/23/23.
Youth C stated he has gotten into fights at the facility, but he did
not want to name who he got into fights with. He stated any time
he gets into a fight staff are there to break it up. Youth C did not
want to talk further because he was missing gym class.
Youth D was unable to be interviewed on 8/23/23 due to his
behavior at the time of the on-site.
Two attempts were made to get in touch with Staff 1 who is
no longer employed at the facility. Staff 1 did not return any of
the phone calls.
3

All staff interviewed on 9/14/23 had the facility's corporate counsel
present.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/14/23.
Staff 2 was asked about the incident on 7/21/23. He stated he
could not recall the incident and thought he may have shown up at
the end. In regards to the incident on 8/9/23 he stated Youth A
approached him and told him Youth C was asking for his food. He
told Youth A to stay by staff. While in the unit Youth A sat next to
Staff 2 then Youth A got up to put a towel in his cubby. After Youth
A sat back down Youth C went to the cubby. Youth C then said he
got played. Staff 2 then went on break and to inform the
supervisors about what was going on with Youth A and Youth C.
When Staff 2 left the unit there was no indication that things were
going to get physical. Youth A remained seated on the other side
of the room.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/14/23.
Staff 3 reported on 8/7/23 she took some of the boys to the gym
and Youth A stayed by her. Youth C came up to Youth A and
talked to him. She could tell the conversation was not going well
and redirected Youth C. Youth C had stated "I heard you were
saying…" Youth C then punched Youth A. Youth A moved away
from Youth C and Youth C followed him and hit him again. Staff 3
said she was the only staff in the gym. She called for assistance
and another staff came in and took Youth A to the unit. Youth C
had run out of the gym. Staff 3 stayed in the gym. She stated she
did not know Youth A and Youth C had “beef” otherwise she
would not have taken them to the gym together. Youth A told her
after the incident that the two were not getting along. She stated
there was nothing beforehand to indicate Youth C would assault
Youth A. Staff 3 stated Youth C is sneaky and manipulative.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/14/23.
Staff 4 was asked about the incident on 8/7/23 but he did not
recall being present for the incident. He stated Youth A is a youth
that needs to be seated by a staff so he is not by youth he has
conflict with. If there is a fight Staff 4 said he will get the
aggressive person to step away and if he can't he will have the
other person step away. He said if there is a fight he notifies the
supervisors. Youth A has had to change units in order to get him
away from youth trying to fight him.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/14/23.
He stated on 8/9/23 Youth A was sitting by the office while Staff 5
4

was at the other end of the unit. Youth C had asked to get up to
go to the bathroom, but he went over and started hitting Youth A.
Staff 5 said there was nothing to indicate this was going to
happen. Staff 5 said he called for assistance and got Youth A out
of the way. Youth A was then seen by the nurse. The supervisors
came and talked to Youth C and secluded him in his room. Staff 5
was unsure if Youth A was moved to a different unit, but they did
keep the two boys separated.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/14/23.
She reported she saw Youth A after the fights he got into and he
did not have any injuries. He complained about his jaw hurting but
nothing about his ear hurting. Nurse expressed her concern with
the increase in fighting between the youth. She felt it was the state
and the restrictions it was placing on staff interventions that was
causing the increase.
Videos Reviewed
Video dated 7/21/23 of the common area outside court was
reviewed. Youth A is seen walking around and walks to the corner
of the yard. Other youth are playing basketball. Another youth,
Youth B, walks to the corner where Youth A is then walks away as
the two staff in the yard approach. Youth B then leaves the yard
with one of the staff.
Video dated 8/7/23 of the gym is viewed. The group is in the gym.
Youth A is standing by the door and Staff 3 is standing in front of
the door. Youth C approaches Youth A along with another youth.
The three youth seem to be talking. Staff 3 turns toward the group
and Youth C punches Youth A in the head. Staff 3 gets in between
the two but Youth C runs past her and runs after Youth A who had
walked away. As Youth C approached Youth A again Youth A falls
to the floor and Youth C punches him over and over again as Staff
3 runs up and separates them. Staff 3 walks Youth C out of the
gym. Youth A gets up from the ground and walks back to the door.
Video dated 8/9/23 of the unit is reviewed. The group is in the
open area of the unit. Youth C is sitting in a chair on the right side
of the room. Staff 5 sits at a table a few feet from Youth C. Youth
A is on the opposite side of the room on the left. Youth D sits at a
table in front of Youth C. Youth C and Youth D seem to be talking.
Youth C and Youth D get up and head toward Youth A. Staff 5
gets up at the same time and approaches the group. Youth C and
Youth D hit Youth A and pull him out of his chair and onto the
floor. Staff 5 steps in to separate them. He gets them separated
then Youth C and Youth D walk to their rooms.
5

Documents Reviewed
Three incident reports were reviewed.
• Dated 7/21/23 involving Youth A and Youth B, with Staff 1
and Staff 2. Staff 1 was assigned to Youth A's group. While
out in the commons area Staff 1 observed what looked like
the aftermath of a short fight between Youth A and Youth
B. Staff 1 noticed Youth A turn and protect his head with his
arms. Youth B was walking toward Youth A with his hands
clenched into fists at his sides. Staff 1 redirected the boys,
Staff 2 removed Youth B from the gym, and Youth A was
seen by the nurse. Staff 1 wrote that Youth A complained of
ear pain.
• Dated 8/7/23 involving Youth A and Youth C with Staff 3
and Staff 4. While the unit was in the gym Youth C
engaged in a conversation with Youth A. The conversation
started to escalate so Staff 3 held up her hand and told
Youth C to stop. Youth C then punched Youth A in the face
and ran after him continuing to punch Youth A. Staff 3
wrote that she tried to break up the fight then Youth C ran
out of the gym. No injury was indicated.
• Dated 8/9/23 involving Youth A, Youth C, and Youth D with
Staff 2, and Staff 5. While at the gym Youth A informed
staff that Youth C was pressuring Youth A for his snack.
Youth A was told to let staff know of any further attempts.
Once back on the unit Youth A asked to use his bathroom.
When Youth A exited his room, he put his towel in his
cubby. Shortly after this Youth C got up without permission
and went to the cubby. Youth C then stated, "I was played."
Youth C was redirected by staff. Staff 2 then went on break.
At this time Youth C and Youth D stood up and started to
approach Youth A. Staff 5 called for assistance. Youth C
and Youth D began to assault Youth A. As support staff
arrived the youth disengaged and went to their rooms.
Youth A went to see the nurse, but no injuries were noted.
Three e-mails titled Post assault assessment were reviewed
stating Youth A was seen by Nurse on 7/21/23, 8/7/23, and
8/9/23.
Analysis The video of all three incidents show that staff were present and
intervened immediately, seeking medical attention following each
incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
